meanings.definition: The amount of electrical power expressed in watts.
meanings.sent1: The wattages of the light bulbs determine how bright they shine.
meanings.sent2: The wattages of the appliances in the house add up to the total power consumption.
meanings.sent3: The competition to see who could generate the most wattages in the science fair was intense.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project generated wattages of energy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sudden surge in wattages caused the circuit breaker to trip.

meanings.definition: The total amount of power output by a device or system.
meanings.sent1: The solar panels' wattages determine how much energy they can produce.
meanings.sent2: The wattages of the generator indicate its power capacity.
meanings.sent3: The robot's malfunction led to erratic wattages being emitted.
meanings.sent4: The concert speakers blasted wattages of sound into the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's performance generated impressive wattages of strength and speed.
